newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London stuck in Friday go-slow.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London stuck in Friday go-slow.

text.p: Japanese stocks were little changed from their closing levels in Tokyo in quiet trading in London, dealers said.
"It's a typical Friday. We're seeing a bit of profit-taking in stocks that have done well and a bit of buying in the ones that have done poorly," said one dealer.
Shares in Fuji Photo Film Co Ltd were among the most actively traded, slipping a tad on profit-taking, dealers said.
At 1416 GMT, the Nikkei 50 index was up 11.66 points from Thursday's London settlement to 1,442.45.
In Tokyo, the Nikkei 225 index added 361.23 points, or two percent, to finish at 17,846.98.
Banks, which have been under heavy selling pressure in recent months, were among the best performers in Tokyo, but dealers said the sector was narrowly mixed in London.
"I don't think this is a turnaround in their fortunes yet," the dealer said of the recent bounce in the bank sector. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
